intro: Spermacoce tenuior var. major, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and gardens.
